line: Emerald twilights, --

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Virginal shy lights,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Wrought of the leaves to allure to the whisper of vows,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: When lovers pace timidly down through the green colonnades

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Of the dim sweet woods, of the dear dark woods,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Of the heavenly woods and glades,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: That run to the radiant marginal sand-beach within

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: The wide sea-marshes of Glynn; --                                     [11]

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Beautiful glooms, soft dusks in the noon-day fire, --

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Wildwood privacies, closets of lone desire,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Chamber from chamber parted with wavering arras of leaves, --

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Cells for the passionate pleasure of prayer to the soul that grieves,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Pure with a sense of the passing of saints through the wood,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Cool for the dutiful weighing of ill with good; --

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: O braided dusks of the oak and woven shades of the vine,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: While the riotous noon-day sun of the June-day long did shine

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Ye held me fast in your heart and I held you fast in mine;

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: But now when the noon is no more, and riot is rest,                       [21]

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And the sun is a-wait at the ponderous gate of the West,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And the slant yellow beam down the wood-aisle doth seem

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Like a lane into heaven that leads from a dream, --

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Ay, now, when my soul all day hath drunken the soul of the oak,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And my heart is at ease from men, and the wearisome sound of the stroke

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Of the scythe of time and the trowel of trade is low,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And belief overmasters doubt, and I know that I know,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And my spirit is grown to a lordly great compass within,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: That the length and the breadth and the sweep of the marshes of Glynn

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Will work me no fear like the fear they have wrought me of yore           [31]

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: When length was fatigue, and when breadth was but bitterness sore,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And when terror and shrinking and dreary unnamable pain

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Drew over me out of the merciless miles of the plain, --

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Oh, now, unafraid, I am fain to face

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: The vast sweet visage of space.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: To the edge of the wood I am drawn, I am drawn,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Where the gray beach glimmering runs, as a belt of the dawn,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: For a mete and a mark

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: To the forest-dark: --

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Affable live-oak, leaning low, --

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Thus -- with your favor -- soft, with a reverent hand,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: (Not lightly touching your person, Lord of the land!)

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Bending your beauty aside, with a step I stand

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: On the firm-packed sand,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Free

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: By a world of marsh that borders a world of sea.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Sinuous southward and sinuous northward the shimmering band

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Of the sand-beach fastens the fringe of the marsh to the folds of the land.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Inward and outward to northward and southward the beach-lines

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: linger and curl                                                         [51]

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: As a silver-wrought garment that clings to and follows

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: the firm sweet limbs of a girl.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Vanishing, swerving, evermore curving again into sight,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Softly the sand-beach wavers away to a dim gray looping of light.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And what if behind me to westward the wall of the woods stands high?

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: The world lies east:  how ample, the marsh and the sea and the sky!

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: A league and a league of marsh-grass, waist-high, broad in the blade,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Green, and all of a height, and unflecked with a light or a shade,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Stretch leisurely off, in a pleasant plain,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: To the terminal blue of the main.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Oh, what is abroad in the marsh and the terminal sea?                     [61]

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Somehow my soul seems suddenly free

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: From the weighing of fate and the sad discussion of sin,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: By the length and the breadth and the sweep of the marshes of Glynn.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Ye marshes, how candid and simple and nothing-withholding and free

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Ye publish yourselves to the sky and offer yourselves to the sea!

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Tolerant plains, that suffer the sea and the rains and the sun,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Ye spread and span like the catholic man who hath mightily won

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: God out of knowledge and good out of infinite pain

line: And sight out of blindness and purity out of a stain.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: As the marsh-hen secretly builds on the watery sod,                       [71]

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Behold I will build me a nest on the greatness of God:

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: I will fly in the greatness of God as the marsh-hen flies

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: In the freedom that fills all the space 'twixt the marsh and the skies:

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: By so many roots as the marsh-grass sends in the sod

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: I will heartily lay me a-hold on the greatness of God:

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Oh, like to the greatness of God is the greatness within

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: The range of the marshes, the liberal marshes of Glynn.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And the sea lends large, as the marsh:  lo, out of his plenty the sea

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Pours fast:  full soon the time of the flood-tide must be:

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Look how the grace of the sea doth go                                     [81]

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: About and about through the intricate channels that flow

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Here and there,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Everywhere,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Till his waters have flooded the uttermost creeks and the low-lying lanes,

line: And the marsh is meshed with a million veins,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: That like as with rosy and silvery essences flow

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: In the rose-and-silver evening glow.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Farewell, my lord Sun!

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: The creeks overflow:  a thousand rivulets run

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: 'Twixt the roots of the sod; the blades of the marsh-grass stir;          [91]

line: And the sea and the marsh are one.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: How still the plains of the waters be!

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: The tide is in his ecstasy.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: The tide is at his highest height:

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And it is night.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And now from the Vast of the Lord will the waters of sleep

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Roll in on the souls of men,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: But who will reveal to our waking ken                                    [101]

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: The forms that swim and the shapes that creep

line: Under the waters of sleep?

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And I would I could know what swimmeth below when the tide comes in

line: On the length and the breadth of the marvellous marshes of Glynn.

line: William Hayes Ward wrote of this poem:  "How naturally his large faith in God

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: He writes:

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: "His best poems move to the cadence of a tune. . . .  Sometimes, as in

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: a cosmic rhythm that is like unto the rhythmic beating of the heart of God,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: of which Poe and Lanier have written eloquently."

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: And later continues:

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: "Indeed, if one had to rely upon one poem to keep alive the fame of Lanier,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: he could single out `The Marshes of Glynn' with assurance

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: that there is something so individual and original about it,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: and that, at the same time, there is such a roll and range of verse in it,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: that it will surely live not only in American poetry but in English.

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Here the imagination has taken the place of fancy, the effort

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: to do great things ends in victory, and the melody of the poem corresponds

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: to the exalted thought.  It has all the strong points of `Sunrise',

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: with but few of its limitations.  There is something of

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: Whitman's virile imagination and Emerson's high spirituality

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: combined with the haunting melody of Poe's best work.  Written in 1878,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: when Lanier was in the full exercise of all his powers,

Poem Title: YAS, DINAH, WHAR 'OULD YOU BE NOW, JES' 'CEPTIN' FUR DAT PRA'R?
line: it is the best expression of his genius and one of the few
